job_description:
Position summary
We are looking for two highly motivated laboratory scientists to join our In vitro team in our Antibody-Drug Conjugate (ADC) Pharmacology division. The successful candidates will become integral members of a dynamic, rapidly growing and highly collaborative matrix environment focusing on preclinical ADC development. The Scientists or Junior Scientists are expected to design and execute relevant in vitro experiments to answer critical questions about compounds and targets under evaluation. The positions will provide a unique opportunity to play a fundamental role in the development of Sotio’s preclinical ADC programs to advance next-generation cancer therapeutics.
Key Activities and Responsibilities
Design, execute and troubleshoot cell-based assays for preclinical ADC discovery.
Ability to maintain accurate and detailed records of experiments, evaluate data, prepare reports and presentations in English for internal meetings in a timely manner.
Proficient at reviewing relevant scientific literature and other available resources to build protocols for compound and target validation experiments.
Work both independently and as part of a collaborative team within drug discovery to achieve shared goals.
Flexibility to acquire additional competencies and skillsets as needed.
Should be highly independent, proactive, and organized.
Competences, Skills and Qualification
Ph.D. or Master’s degree in cancer/cell/immunology/molecular biology or related fields with 3 years of in vitro pharmacology experience, for the Scientist or Junior Scientist position, respectively.
Hands-on experience in cell culture, cell-based assays, and molecular biology techniques to screen compounds in proliferation, cytotoxicity, drug response etc. experiments. Techniques included, but not limited to, proliferation assessment, flow cytometry, ELISA, Western blotting, RT-qPCR.
Hands-on experience in the processing of single-cell suspension from mammalian tissues and tumors.
Ability to conduct data analysis using Microsoft Excel, GraphPad PRISM, or equivalent software.
Must have strong attention to detail in a rapidly changing environment and ability to work on multiple programs simultaneously.
Knowledge of the English language on the professional level is required (written and verbal communication skills).
Working knowledge of live cell imaging (such as IncuCyte) and image analysis is an advantage.
Experience with oncology projects is preferred.
Working with hazardous biological and chemical substances under the appropriate safety measures is part of the job description.
Hepatitis B vaccination will be required.
Title of positions (Scientist/Junior Scientist) will be matched with candidates’ qualifications and years of experience.
Location
Prague
pros: ["-Small company, lots of face time with principal players across all departments. -Everyone's input is welcome and actually taken into consideration when making decisions. -Company is high respectful of work life balance. Everyone is given a choice to work in person, or remote or a hybrid. -Benefits package is amazing (beyond base salary, all insurances are covered by employer). -401K match!! -Collogues are an absolute joy to work with!", 'Good location Some really smart fellows Interesting job', 'Interesting projects, pipeline, acquisition plans and investments.', 'Company full of wise high educated people who know pharmacy and science. Good working environment and team spirit.']

On a daily basis - hostile environment that would be better avoided.', 'Very carefuly watched budged, many projects are being postponed.']

job_titles: Senior Scientist, Preclinical in vivo Pharmacology
job_description:
At Genmab, we’re committed to building extra[not]ordinary futures together, by developing antibody products and pioneering, knock-your-socks-off therapies that change the lives of patients and the future of cancer treatment and serious diseases. From our people who are caring, candid, and impact-driven to our business, which is innovative and rooted in science, we believe that being proudly unique, determined to be our best, and authentic is essential to fulfilling our purpose.
About Us
Genmab is an international biotechnology company specializing in the invention and development of differentiated human antibody therapeutics for the treatment of cancer and other important human diseases.
The Role
You will work in multidisciplinary international expert teams to discover and develop antibody therapeutics. As a Scientist in the Preclinical in vivo Pharmacology group you will work on the development of ground-breaking new medicines from concept to clinical candidate through the design and execution of cutting-edge in vivo and ex vivo research.
Responsibilities
You are responsible for the design and performance of in vivo studies needed for the evaluation and efficacy testing of the antibody compounds and you work with a team of skilled research associates
You collaborate effectively with external CRO’s which provide in vivo & ex vivo expertise
You will manage several lines of outsourced activities within our group
You will translate complex immune-oncology and antibody biology research questions into in vivo efficacy models
With your up-to-date knowledge of in vivo models you provide scientifically knowledge in the different teams
You will keep track on state of art knowledge within the field of immuno-oncology and preclinical in vivo efficacy models
You intensively work together with internal scientists/experts of the antibody format development, antibody product development and translation research team
From an in vivo perspective, you will actively contribute to scientific publications, presentations and internal and external meetings
You will support patent applications, and the documentation critical to enter the next stages of product development
Requirements
You are on your way to become the best in your area of expertise. You follow new scientific developments closely and take an active role in your field of knowledge. You take initiative and strive to achieve the goals that are important to Genmab. You enjoy working in a team and your enthusiasm inspires others.
Moreover, you meet the following professional requirements:
You hold a PhD and at least 2 years of relevant work experience
You have extensive experience in the field of in vivo research, preferably in oncology or immunology
You preferably have industry experience (either within a biotech company or at a CRO) or have worked closely with CROs
You are science driven and pragmatic in your experimental in vivo design
You have an affinity with medicine and translating clinical observations into laboratory research
You hold an Art 9 certification (or comparable)
You have excellent organizational, communicative and relational skills and you are business fluent in English
You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, have a ‘getting things done mentality', you are goal-oriented, efficient and accurate and you enjoy working in a team
You pro-actively drive your projects and think along with other team members
You set high-quality standards and keep an eye on ways to improve your work
About You
You are passionate about our purpose and genuinely care about our mission to transform the lives of patients through innovative cancer treatment
You bring rigor and excellence to all that you do. You are a fierce believer in our rooted-in-science approach to problem-solving
You are a generous collaborator who can work in teams with diverse backgrounds
You are determined to do and be your best and take pride in enabling the best work of others on the team
You are not afraid to grapple with the unknown and be innovative
You have experience working in a fast-growing, dynamic company (or a strong desire to)
You work hard and are not afraid to have a little fun while you do so
Locations
Genmab leverages the effectiveness of an agile working environment, when possible, for the betterment of employee work-life balance. Our offices are designed as open, community-based spaces that work to connect employees while being immersed in our state-of-the-art laboratories. Whether you’re in one of our collaboratively designed office spaces or working remotely, we thrive on connecting with each other to innovate.
About Genmab
Founded in 1999 in Copenhagen, Denmark, Genmab is an innovative biotech company that has become a leader in antibody biology and innovation. Our product pipeline and next-generation antibody technologies are the result of our strong company culture, a deep passion for innovation, and desire to transform cancer treatment and serious diseases.
When you work with us, you’ll be part of a warm, fun, dynamic community, and team up with some of the best, most authentic individuals in locations around the world, who care deeply and share in a relentless drive to innovate and create transformational medicines. People who are candid, impact-driven, and a little unconventional; who seek out and embrace the opportunity to build new and bold futures within a rapidly growing and innovative biotech company; who bring their full selves to work and show up for each other - rolling up their sleeves to get the job done. This translates into a place where you can be authentically you; are empowered to innovate, build solutions, and execute; feel cared for and supported in growth; and are a critical part of changing the lives of patients around the world through transformative cancer treatment.
Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion
We are committed to fostering workplace diversity at all levels of the company and we believe it is essential for our continued success. No applicant shall be discriminated against or treated unfairly because of their race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, or genetic information. Learn more about our commitments on our website.
Genmab is committed to protecting your personal data and privacy. Please see our privacy policy for handling your data in connection with your application on our website https://www.genmab.com/privacy.
Please note that if you are applying for a position in the Netherlands, Genmab’s policy for all permanently budgeted hires in NL is initially to offer a fixed-term employment contract for a year, if the employee performs well and if the business conditions do not change, renewal for an indefinite term may be considered after the fixed-term employment contract.
pros: ['The culture is amazing sometimes', "The people and culture at Genmab are unlike anything else I've experienced. Strong benefits and focus on employee rewards and well-being (company shut down days, equity grants, etc)", "Paid holidays btw Christmas and New Year's Most coworkers are nice", 'Great salary and benefits. Great one day work-free once a month. Great company to work if you have a good manager.', "Half of the time, they don't know what they are doing", 'Many of the employees of this company are the best in their field. Always something to learn in this collegial environment where the medicines are inspiring and the technology platforms impressive. Small Pharma feel with Big Pharma stability.', 'Company takes care of their employees.\r\nMost colleagues are friendly. \r\nHave products making money and promising products in pipeline.']
cons:
['Development within role leaves something to be desired.', "As a company that is growing, there are some things that aren't figured out yet. You can take that as a challenge to build, or get frustrated... I like the challenge and opportunity to be a part of building it.", "Green senior management who're trying to micromanage everything", 'Manager spoke in condescending manner to fellow drug safety physicians and scientists and sometimes ridiculed colleagues during safety meetings boasting "I can't teach you guys medicine". One Safety Physician left in anger immediately after an inexperienced manager who unfortunately was well liked by senior management insulted her in a meeting despite being cautioned to stop and yet continued. She demonized everyone working under her without justification. The department is now breathing a sigh of relief after the manager's exit and with an new manager who is humane and treats her direct reports with respect.', 'Confused on how to conduct a clinical trial', 'Collaborations make business operations and strategic planning difficult/cumbersome.', 'Company (at least in US) is very confused about their identity.

Are they a nimble biotech like they claim or are they big pharma? Based on all the BMS expats and their philosophy for building the organization, I would say they are more similar to a big pharma company than an agile, nimble biotech. 

Company is extremely top heavy with most hires being at the Associate Director to Senior Director levels.. no one under them to actually do work. Instead, the work is outsourced to contractors and consultants who more times than not, are provided inaccurate requirements and therefore, deliver subpar deliverables.']

job_description: As a Lab Assistant, you will work in the Lab Support team under supervision of the Lab Manager, with the help of a Junior Lab Assistant, to make sure that labs stay operational, are kept clean, stocked up, and organized at any time. Your responsibilities enable the (Associate) Scientists and Study Directors to run commercial projects, but also allows you to keep a check on the use of labware, disposables and reagents, to be able to prevent misconduct or potential shortages.ResponsibilitiesPreparation & storage of reagents for use in the laboratoryHelp to keep equipment and labs in a workable conditionRegular inventory checks for keeping stocks up to dateOrdering reagents and disposables for laboratoryTaking care of laboratory waste, laundry and CO2-supplyMonitor cleaning of general accessible lab areas (e.g. floor and benches)Support (Associate) Scientists and Study Directors with their cell culture/ isolation/ aliquoting tasks if neededTraining of new employees related to laboratory usePreparation of new and updating current SOPs, forms, MBRs and other quality documents for CBNLRequirementsHLO or Bachelor's degree in Biomedical sciences, Chemistry, or similar2+ years’ experience in a similar role, preferably within a cGMP guidelines or ISO certified companyKnowledge of MS OfficeKnowledge of Oracle is a plusExperience with or ability to write and follow SOP’sStrong verbal and written English language skillsExcellent organization skillsStrong affinity for qualityHigh level of accuracy and eye for detailProactive approach and solution-orientedEligible to live and work in the Netherlands (no sponsorship possible)What we offerGreat work environment in a fast-growing businessInternational employer with diverse group of colleagues & great team spiritCompetitive salaryAnnual bonusPension contribution25 holidaysAbout usCrown Bioscience is a leading preclinical pharmacology CRO with the largest collection of tumor models and provides services to pharmaceutical and biotech companies globally. Crown Bioscience made a direct contribution to nearly half FDA-approved oncology drugs in 2020. Over the years, we have extensively profiled several thousand tumor models for their genomics, pharmacology, and histopathology. These rich data resources provide an ideal basis for studying cancer genomics, with direct impact on the discovery and development of novel cancer therapeutics.Job Type: Full-timeWork Location: One location

job_description:
Hybridize: a new perspective
Treating kidney diseases with RNA-based therapies
About us
“Do you want to join us on our journey to change the lives of millions of kidney patients?”
Kidney disease is a major problem. Worldwide 1:10 people are suffering from chronic kidney disease (CKD). A progressive clinical unmet need that results in kidney failure with a growing number of people needing to rely on dialysis to survive. It is therefore the 8th leading cause of death in Western society.
We are Hybridize Therapeutics. We are a growing Biotech start-up on the forefront of developing innovative RNA-based therapies for kidney patients. We are driven to make a difference and prevent people from ending up with the severe consequences of kidney failure. We believe RNA therapeutics are the perfect modality to treat kidney disease. Our deep expertise & network in the field of RNA therapeutics will help us be pioneers in this field. Will you join us on our mission?
We are looking for extraordinary people who:
Are inspired by our mission: to prevent people ending up with kidney failure
Love to be creative, but are also critical thinkers, real pioneers
Want to work in a fast paced, start-up environment with a strong focus on R&D
Are looking for a tight and close team, who also love an occasional drink or dinner
Role description
We are looking for our company’s chief visionary scientist as a critical expansion of the management. The CSO understands open innovation in a young biotech firm and has deep experience in leading a development program to the clinic. The CSO keeps oversight over the entire pipeline strategy but is also pragmatic removing roadblocks where needed. The CSO works closely with Hybridize’s CIO and internal scientists and with a broad network of academic labs and companies globally. We are seeking a seasoned leader keeping us at the forefront of emerging fields of biology.
Key responsibilities
Steers strategy for portfolio expansion
Enable intellectual property expansion in emerging fields of RNA biology
Implement new research programs/technologies in close collaboration with internal and external resources
Expand external (academic) network of Hybridize
Strong steering role in short and long term goals and overall scientific strategy
Support the CEO in financial rounds
Enable a culture of rigorous scientific work
Significantly contribute to the further development and maturation of Hybridize Therapeutics
Further the product development of existing and partnered pipeline
Your experience / qualifications
Ph.D. in Biology or Pharmacology
>15 years of experience as allrounder Sr Scientist in pharma/biotech environment, including startup experience
Proven track record in drug discovery of RNA-based products/technology
Significant experience with building out IP/portfolio
Track record in fundraising up to Series A
Expertise in delivering drug discovery projects from target validation to IND-stages
Understanding of kidney disease or other disease biology and disease-relevant signaling pathways
Ability to provide guidance and shape strategy for science in an evolving highly dynamic biotech environment
Passion for science
Visionary
Persistent
Flexible, enjoys constantly changing environment
Systematic way of working
Enjoys challenges
If you would like to know more about Hybridize Therapeutics, this position and our offer, feel free to contact us via info@hybridizetherapeutics.com

Company Description
Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, which provides a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries. The Group believes it is the world leader in food, environment, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in
certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and for supporting clinical studies. In addition, Eurofins is one of the leading global emerging players in specialty clinical diagnostic testing.

In 2021, Eurofins generated 6.7 billion Euro proforma turnover in 900 laboratories across 54 countries, employing over 58.000 staff.

PSS Insourcing Solutions (PSS) is an award-winning solution for pharmaceutical companies. At the request of pharmaceutical customers, PSS provides dedicated, qualified and trained Eurofins personnel who work at a customer’s location using customer facilities, equipment, computer systems, SOPs and methods. Our employees work on a predefined project or activities at the customer’s location. PSS employs around 1.700 employees worldwide. In the Netherlands you get about 100 enthusiastic colleagues, spread over five customer locations. We offer you a career with a world leader in the field op lab expertise. At PSS, collegiality, collaboration, customer focus and delivering high-quality work are
paramount.

Job Description
For our location in Leiden we are looking for an enthusiastic Lab Support Technician to join the team.
The Lab Support Technician is responsible for the integrity and maintenance of the sample/reagent inventory at the Clinical Immunology (CI) department. All sample movement and preparation actions are performed under GCLP guidelines.
Lab support activities:
Heat inactivation for incoming samples (BSL-2 conditions);Create and maintain stocks of non-critical assay reagents by registering them in LIMS and aliquoting;Inventarize and keep track of consumable and reagent stocks;Prepare fresh Virkon solutions for use in assays;Perform preventive equipment maintenance tasks for generic lab equipment (e.g. BSC, Incubators, Storage equipment).
Sample logistic activities
Physical receival of sample shipments and complete associated documentation;Register the samples into the system;Prepare outgoing sample shipments and associated documentation;Picking of samples for outgoing shipments;Sort samples within the inventory to optimize storage capacity;

Qualifications
MLO degree in Biology, Biochemistry, Life Sciences or related sciences;Experience in a pharmaceutical environment and knowledge of GCLP is preferred;Experience with cell culture is preferred;Flexible and teamwork/communication skills;Accurate, and attention to detail;Ability to work independently and within a cross-functional team;Ability to learn new tasks and multitask;Self-motivated with a positive attitude;Good command of Dutch and English (Spoken/written)
Additional Information
PSS and Eurofins: A world of possibilities

Working at PSS means working with highly motivated people with a can-do mentality. Our people work in an international environment, within an enthusiastic team and for an organization where there is sufficient room to develop further. Working together is extremely important to us and having fun in what you do is part of that! Our monthly team lunches,
team activities and the hand out of awards to our colleagues are an example of this. We also offer:
A responsible and challenging position within the team;
Plenty of room for your own ideas and input;
Specialist training and a range of opportunities for personal and professional development;
Flexible working hours;
Good salary and benefits.
Working at PSS offers you the flexibility and personal touch of working in a medium sized and dynamic company, whilst also allowing you to benefit from having Eurofins as a parent company. Our ambitious growth plans provide ample opportunities for the motivated employees:
Plenty of opportunities for growth;
Varied work where you are in regular contact with other companies and scientists within the Eurofins group;
A broad customer portfolio ensuring a lot of diversity in your work.
Would you like to know more?

For questions regarding the position, please follow the link below ‘I’m interested’ in order to contact the hiring manager.

Acquisition for this vacancy is not appreciated.

job_titles: PhD in human placental vascular physiology
job_description:
PhD in human placental vascular physiology
Closing date 13-03-2023
 09.08.23.TS
 36 hours
 Research university
 Research & Education
Apply
Questions? Contact our recruiter
Closing date 13-03-2023
 09.08.23.TS
 Job description
Job description
Adequate development and function of the placenta are essential for a healthy pregnancy and especially for fetal development. Indeed, impaired placental development affects placental vascular perfusion leading to severe diseases, such as fetal growth restriction and preeclampsia. These diseases cannot be treated yet, often forcing physicians to initiate premature delivery with many short- and long-term risks for both mother and infant.

At the Erasmus MC Placenta Lab we believe that the placenta provides a unique opportunity to treat pregnancy disorders that are associated with its dysfunction. For this we combine knowledge from multiple fields including physiology, molecular biology and pharmacology. We develop new breakthrough diagnostic and therapeutic strategies to cure placenta-related disorders and to even allow targeting fetal diseases before birth. The placenta has been undervalued for a long time, however, it is mainly made up of vascular trees that are of fetal origin. After delivery, the placenta thus allows us to gain insight into placental and fetal vascular development and physiology.

The aim of your PhD project is to better understand the regulators of placental vascular function and the associated alterations in placenta-related disorders in order to identify new therapeutic targets. The location of our Placenta Lab within the largest children’s hospital of the Netherlands will enable you to collect placentas from both healthy as well as diseased patients, who you approach for informed consent yourself. Using these real-life human tissues, you will perform research and apply unique models to study placental physiology and pharmacology. This includes the ex vivo dual-sided placenta perfusion model, wire myography, pressure myography, placental explants, primary cell culture and numerous molecular assays. You will do this in a multi-disciplinary environment, closely collaborating with fundamental scientists including pharmacologists and biologists, as well as clinicians from the fields of obstetrics and neonatology.
Work environment
Work environment
The placenta lab is a multidisciplinary collaboration between fundamental (pharmacology) and clinical (obstetrics and neonatology) departments within the Erasmus MC. This set-up provides the unique opportunity to perform translational research using human biological material, not only from healthy pregnancies, but even more importantly, also from pathological pregnancies. The close collaboration between fundamental scientists and clinicians allows us to work on and eventually answer questions that directly arise from the clinical field, with the ultimate purpose to improve the well-being of pregnant women and their children.
Qualifications and skills
Qualifications and skills
The candidate finished a Master in Biomedical Sciences, (Medical) Biology, Pharmaceutical Sciences, Medicine or a related Masters background
The candidate has a strong and enthusiastic motivation for a PhD track that combines fundamental and translational research
The candidate has research experience with molecular and/or cell biology as well as biostatistics
The candidate has affinity with the fields of physiology, pharmacology, and molecular biology
The candidate has fluent English language proficiency and excellent writing skills (Dutch communication is considered a strong point)
The candidate has a positive work attitude, and is able to work independently as well as in a team

Before you apply please check our conditions for employment.
Terms of employment
Terms of employment
You will receive a temporary position for 4 years. The gross monthly salary is € 2.789,- in the 1st year and increases to € 3.536,- in the 4th year (scale OIO).
Excellent fringe benefits, such as a 13th month that is already paid out in November and a individual travel expense package.
Pension insurance with ABP. We take care of approximately 2/3 of the monthly contribution.
Special benefits, such as a incompany physiotherapist and bicycle repairer. And there is also a gym where you can work on your fitness after work.

More information
More information
For more information about this position and selection procedure, please contact Michelle Broekhuizen, principal investigator, Department of Neonatology and Pharmacology, email: m.broekhuizen@erasmusmc.nl, phone number: +31 (0)10 703 30 50.
No agencies please.
pros: ['Lots of facilities and technicians that help. Various disciplines for multi disciplinary research. Big names with lots of expertise. Very collaborative environment, almost everyone is helpful.']
cons: ['THEY CUT YOUR CONTRACT AT ANY TIME WITH FORCE AND BLACKMAILS. Can fire you at any time. No support for complaints etc especially for big names. Have no problem that you work underpaid, almost modern slavery conditions unless you are friend. Very helpful to the Dutch. Most epats write theri thesis unpaid. Very provocative promotions of Dutch people with no minimum qualifications. PHD counselors are there for the interests of the PI and not so much for the students interests. Big names think they are gods and know everything including regard']

job_titles: (Senior) Research Associate, Preclinical in vivo Pharmacology
job_description:
At Genmab, we’re committed to building extra[not]ordinary futures together, by developing antibody products and pioneering, knock-your-socks-off therapies that change the lives of patients and the future of cancer treatment and serious diseases. From our people who are caring, candid, and impact-driven to our business, which is innovative and rooted in science, we believe that being proudly unique, determined to be our best, and authentic is essential to fulfilling our purpose.
About Us
At Genmab, we’re committed to building extra[not]ordinary futures together, by developing antibody products and pioneering, knock-your-socks-off therapies that change the lives of patients and the future of cancer treatment and serious diseases. From our people who are caring, candid, and impact-driven to our business, which is innovative and rooted in science, we believe that being proudly unique, determined to be our best, and authentic is essential to fulfilling our purpose.
The Role
Genmab is seeking a (Senior) Research Associate in the Preclinical in vivo Pharmacology group that works on the development of knock-your-socks-off antibodies and is responsible for a broad set of in vivo studies to evaluate the mechanism of action of Genmab’s innovative antibodies. The position is temporary with the possibility for an extension and a permanent contract.
Responsibilities
You will work in a team with scientists and technicians performing in vivo and ex vivo studies for preclinical efficacy testing of therapeutic antibody products.
You have practical experience with animals models and with your up-to-date knowledge of immunology, tumor biology and cell biology, you are responsible for accurate realization of experiments in assigned studies.
You help to organize the setup of experiments, document, perform, process and statistically analyze the test results and report these to the team.
By investigating the mechanisms of action of our antibodies in vivo you contribute to the selection of clinical candidates and moving the antibody product forward to the clinic.
Requirements
You are experienced and motivated to work in the field of animal models, immunology and tumor biology. You are enthusiastic, goal-oriented, and capable of working efficiently and accurately, and you enjoy working in a team. You take initiative, set high standards for quality, and continuously suggest how to improve your work. You are also interested in learning and developing new skills and are driven to work together on the development of a new generation of medicines. You are flexible to accommodate the needs of in vivo studies and a growing organization.
You have a completed HLO education or equivalent.
You have an Experiment on Animals (art 13f2) certification
You have experience (2-3 year) with in vivo work.
You have knowledge and preferably experience with immunological in vitro techniques such as cell culture, flow cytometry and ELISA.
Knowledge of immunology, tumor biology, cell biology, and statistics is preferred.
You work in a structured method and have good organizational skills
You are capable of running several experiments in parallel
You are flexible to accommodate changing priorities and occasional work outside office hours
You recognize the importance of working in accordance to the agreed Quality System, which includes adhering to procedures and detailed documentation of your work.
You are fluent in both English and Dutch, which is spoken in the team and office.
About You
You are passionate about our purpose and genuinely care about our mission to transform the lives of patients through innovative cancer treatment
You bring rigor and excellence to all that you do. You are a fierce believer in our rooted-in-science approach to problem-solving
You are a generous collaborator who can work in teams with diverse backgrounds
You are determined to do and be your best and take pride in enabling the best work of others on the team
You are not afraid to grapple with the unknown and be innovative
You have experience working in a fast-growing, dynamic company (or a strong desire to)
You work hard and are not afraid to have a little fun while you do so
Locations
Genmab leverages the effectiveness of an agile working environment, when possible, for the betterment of employee work-life balance. Our offices are designed as open, community-based spaces that work to connect employees while being immersed in our state-of-the-art laboratories. Whether you’re in one of our collaboratively designed office spaces or working remotely, we thrive on connecting with each other to innovate.
About Genmab
Founded in 1999 in Copenhagen, Denmark, Genmab is an innovative biotech company that has become a leader in antibody biology and innovation. Our product pipeline and next-generation antibody technologies are the result of our strong company culture, a deep passion for innovation, and desire to transform cancer treatment and serious diseases.
When you work with us, you’ll be part of a warm, fun, dynamic community, and team up with some of the best, most authentic individuals in locations around the world, who care deeply and share in a relentless drive to innovate and create transformational medicines. People who are candid, impact-driven, and a little unconventional; who seek out and embrace the opportunity to build new and bold futures within a rapidly growing and innovative biotech company; who bring their full selves to work and show up for each other - rolling up their sleeves to get the job done. This translates into a place where you can be authentically you; are empowered to innovate, build solutions, and execute; feel cared for and supported in growth; and are a critical part of changing the lives of patients around the world through transformative cancer treatment.
Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion
We are committed to fostering workplace diversity at all levels of the company and we believe it is essential for our continued success. No applicant shall be discriminated against or treated unfairly because of their race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, or genetic information. Learn more about our commitments on our website.
Genmab is committed to protecting your personal data and privacy. Please see our privacy policy for handling your data in connection with your application on our website https://www.genmab.com/privacy.
Please note that if you are applying for a position in the Netherlands, Genmab’s policy for all permanently budgeted hires in NL is initially to offer a fixed-term employment contract for a year, if the employee performs well and if the business conditions do not change, renewal for an indefinite term may be considered after the fixed-term employment contract.
pros: ['The culture is amazing sometimes', "The people and culture at Genmab are unlike anything else I've experienced. Strong benefits and focus on employee rewards and well-being (company shut down days, equity grants, etc)", "Paid holidays btw Christmas and New Year's Most coworkers are nice", 'Great salary and benefits. Great one day work-free once a month. Great company to work if you have a good manager.', "Half of the time, they don't know what they are doing", 'Many of the employees of this company are the best in their field. Always something to learn in this collegial environment where the medicines are inspiring and the technology platforms impressive. Small Pharma feel with Big Pharma stability.', 'Company takes care of their employees.\r\nMost colleagues are friendly. \r\nHave products making money and promising products in pipeline.']
cons:
['Development within role leaves something to be desired.', "As a company that is growing, there are some things that aren't figured out yet. You can take that as a challenge to build, or get frustrated... I like the challenge and opportunity to be a part of building it.", "Green senior management who're trying to micromanage everything", 'Manager spoke in condescending manner to fellow drug safety physicians and scientists and sometimes ridiculed colleagues during safety meetings boasting "I can't teach you guys medicine". One Safety Physician left in anger immediately after an inexperienced manager who unfortunately was well liked by senior management insulted her in a meeting despite being cautioned to stop and yet continued. She demonized everyone working under her without justification. The department is now breathing a sigh of relief after the manager's exit and with an new manager who is humane and treats her direct reports with respect.', 'Confused on how to conduct a clinical trial', 'Collaborations make business operations and strategic planning difficult/cumbersome.', 'Company (at least in US) is very confused about their identity.

Are they a nimble biotech like they claim or are they big pharma? Based on all the BMS expats and their philosophy for building the organization, I would say they are more similar to a big pharma company than an agile, nimble biotech. 

Company is extremely top heavy with most hires being at the Associate Director to Senior Director levels.. no one under them to actually do work. Instead, the work is outsourced to contractors and consultants who more times than not, are provided inaccurate requirements and therefore, deliver subpar deliverables.']

job_description:
Company Description
The QC Lab of Eurofins Bactimm in Nijmegen is part of the international operating Eurofins Scientific and offers a diverse package of microbiological analyses regarding raw materials and finished products for various national and international clients within the pharmaceutical and medical device industry. The package of microbiological includes performing of bioburden tests, sterility tests, growth promotion tests and indication of microorganisms.

Job Description
Eurofins offers a wide range of testing capabilities across its laboratory network in Europe. This includes, amongst others, microbiology, biocompatibility, toxicology, and chemical characterization. Testing outsourced within the Eurofins network is coordinated by the Coordinator Interco Operations. The Coordinator Interco Operations will interact and coordinate with customer and project managers of the performing laboratory to provide information necessary for testing.

The Coordinator Interco Operations will collaborate closely with sales representatives and will be frequently involved in client meetings. He or she will keep track of progress of analytical projects carried out by laboratories in the network and will pro-actively take action to ensure the analytical projects are delivered in accordance with the agreed timelines and the agreed scope. The Coordination Interco Operations will interact and coordinate with project managers who are responsible for testing in the laboratory.
Responsibilities
Contact person for customer and performing laboratory;
Proactively keeping track of status and progress with performing laboratory;
Registration of samples and sending samples to performing laboratory;
Answering questions of customer and performing laboratory;
Organizing business review meetings with performing laboratory.

Qualifications

Master of Science in healthcare or biological field (e.g., Biology, Biotech, Biomedical Engineering, Toxicology, etc.)
Is goal oriented
Is an initiative-taker
Being able to work in detail
Strong sense of responsibility
Fluent in English and Dutch.
Additional Information
Bactimm and Eurofins: A world of possibilities
This position is based at Eurofins Bactimm in Nijmegen. We highly value our strong team spirit and encourage collaboration between colleagues.
Eurofins Bactimm offers a wide range of personal and professional possibilities:
A responsible and challenging position within the team;
Plenty of room for your own ideas and input;
Specialist training and a range of opportunities for personal and professional development;
Flexible working hours;
Good salary and benefits.
Working at Eurofins Bactimm offers you the flexibility and personal touch of working in a medium sized and dynamic company, whilst also allowing you to benefit from having Eurofins as a parent company. Our ambitious growth plans provide ample opportunities for the motivated employees:
Plenty of opportunities for growth;
Varied work where you are in regular contact with other companies and scientists within the Eurofins group;
A broad customer portfolio ensuring a lot of diversity in your work.
Would you like to know more?
For questions regarding the position, please follow the link below ‘I’m interested’ in order to contact the hiring manager.
Acquisition for this vacancy is not appreciated.
More about Eurofins Scientific
Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, which provides a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries. The Group believes it is the world leader in food, environment, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and for supporting clinical studies. In addition, Eurofins is one of the leading global emerging players in specialty clinical diagnostic testing.

In 2021, Eurofins generated 6.72 billion Euro proforma turnover in 900 laboratories across 54 countries, employing about 58.000 staff.

Our people at Euros make an important contribution to issues such as the environment, food and general health. Employees are proud of the work they do and experience a lot of freedom in the performance of the job. Responsibilities are as low as possible in the organization so that the people with the right information can start taking the right ones. Eurofins invests structurally in the personal development of talent, both in the field of leadership, growth potential and substantive knowledge.
pros: ["Great compensation/amazing benefits/Easy to communicate with/Give you a chance to work in a great client' site. Outstanding managements. Great online trainings/orientation. Very helpful information and courses in the share point system.", '*they care about the growth of their employees *opportunity for vertical and horizontal career growth (scientist, senior scientist, principal, etc; group leader, manager, director, etc) *continuously improving their trainings *warm and empathetic senior leaders that actually listen *employee development plans that value your trajectory within the company *KPIs that are reasonable, easy to overachieve if the motivation to grow is there *work-life that is honored and a part of the culture (ie, encouraged to take PTO) *work that is challenging and interesting *plenty of opportunities to innovate', "I Recently started working at the Eurofins PSS site in Richmond VA. Everyone has been incredibly supportive and very friendly. My GL, along with the other GL's and Management staff work hard to create a good environment to help you thrive and succeed in. Since I have started here, I have been met with positivity from not just management, but also other members of the Staff. I am very glad to be a part of the Eurofins Family and look forward to growing my career here."]
cons: ['I have nothing to complain about. So far so good', "*your experiences may vary per PSS site, however, mines has been very positive *as in any company, your manager will play a big role in your day-to-day therefore experiences may vary; however the company does place a big emphasis on hiring from within to managerial positions, and therefore managers tend to exhibit the positive values of the company culture *rising quickly can be difficult since the business need and role needs to be available, but this is not unlike at any other company; my advice and make yourself invaluable and be great at what you do and you'll be top of mind for any incoming opportunities (ie, be flexible) *DEI initiatives are good, but they definitely need more representation at the top *compensation is fair, expect about market-value", 'Further commute then my last job.']
